intro: Solanum indicum var. depauperatum, commonly known as the Indian nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to India and parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its small, sparsely leafed structure. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its berries, which are usually green when immature, turn red when ripe and are edible but contain toxic compounds. This species is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields.
